title: Gaza: A few notes of beauty amid the devastation
subhead: Musician Ahmed Abu Amsha teaches guitar and singing to children in displacement camps, where famine is widespread. Each week, the teacher and his students perform in public, offering brief moments of calm.

title: More and more Ethiopians are risking their lives at sea in attempts to reach Yemen
subhead: On August 3, at least 90 migrants died when their boat sank in the Gulf of Aden. All of them hailed from Ethiopia's Tigray region, which has been plagued by ongoing political instability after two years of civil war.
byline: By Marlène Panara (Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, correspondent)

title: Three erotic experiences inspired by the internet
subhead: Maïa Mazaurette is on a mission to spice up your steamy summer nights. This week, she explores the possibilities created by AI, makes use of assistants (not necessarily digital ones) and as a seasoned archaeologist, exhumes an old website.

Iceland's Eyjafjallajökull volcano is being overrun by Instagrammers
subhead: 'Of Volcanoes and Men' (4/6). Made famous by its spectacular 2010 eruption, Eyjafjallajökull in Iceland has since attracted waves of tourists armed with their smartphones. Finnish photographer Juuso Westerlund followed in the footsteps of these crowds, who have transformed a rugged, wild landscape into an Instagram backdrop.

title: When partying and protest go hand in hand: 'Celebrating together re-energizes activists'
subhead: 'Why Do We Party?' (4/6). Collectives and artists are working to put festivities at the heart of their activism. It is a way to fight activist fatigue, attract young people to their causes and escape repression.

title: Russia's prisons carry the ghosts of the Gulag and Ukrainian martyrs: 'The interrogations were carried out by professionals in torture'
subhead: Yulian Pylepei, a naval infantryman released just a few months ago, has passed through six different detention sites since 2022, many of them infamous.
